metadata.Title: CVE-2023-46849 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Using the --fragment option in certain configuration setups OpenVPN version 2.6.0 to 2.6.6 allows an attacker to trigger a divide by zero behaviour which could cause an application crash, leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-46849` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvpn - 2.5.5-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvpn package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.5-1ubuntu3.1').
